IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: TO ADVANCE WILSON COLLEGE OF TEXTILES THROUGH ENGAGEMENT, PARTNERSHIP AND PHILANTHROPY.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MISSION OF THE FOUNDATION IS TO ADVANCE WILSON COLLEGE OF TEXTILES THROUGH ENGAGEMENT, PARTNERSHIP AND PHILANTHROPY. AS A CHARITABLE ORGANIZATION, THE FOUNDATION SUPPORTS THE COLLEGE AND DEAN OF THE COLLEGE AND SUCH SUPPORT SHALL INCLUDE BUT IS NOT LIMITED TO PROVIDING FUNDS FOR SCHOLARSHIPS TO DESERVING UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE STUDENTS; RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION OF HIGHLY QUALIFIED STUDENTS, EDUCATORS AND RESEARCHERS; AND PLACEMENT OF GRADUATES. THE FOUNDATION ALSO ASSISTS IN THE ACQUISITION AND MAINTENANCE OF STATE-OF-THE-ART EQUIPMENT AND FACILITIES FOR RESEARCH AND EDUCATION.
IRS990.Desc: THE FOUNDATION SUPPORTS THE COLLEGE OF TEXTILES AT NORTH CAROLINA STATE UNIVERSITY THROUGH GRANTS FOR FACILITIES, FACULTY, FELLOWSHIPS, SCHOLARSHIPS AND EQUIPMENT.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE FOUNDATION AWARDS SCHOLARSHIPS TO DESERVING GRADUATE AND UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS OF THE COLLEGE OF TEXTILES AT NORTH CAROLINA STATE UNIVERSITY BASED ON MERIT.

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: NC STATE INVESTMENT FUND, INC. LT INVESTMENT POOL

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION'S ENDOWMENT CONSISTS OF APPROXIMATELY 120 INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES RELATED TO THE MISSION OF THE UNIVERSITY.

MANAGEMENT HAS ANALYZED THE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE FOUNDATION, AND HAS CONCLUDED THAT AS OF JUNE 30, 2023, THERE ARE NO UNCERTAIN POSITIONS TAKEN OR EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN THAT WOULD REQUIRE RECOGNITION OF A LIABILITY (OR ASSET) OR DISCLOSURE IN THE ACCOMPANYING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. THE FOUNDATION IS SUBJECT TO ROUTINE AUDITS BY TAXING JURISDICTIONS; HOWEVER, THERE ARE CURRENTLY NO AUDITS FOR ANY TAX PERIODS IN PROGRESS. MANAGEMENT BELIEVES IT IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS FOR YEARS PRIOR TO TAX YEAR 2019.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS -35,029.

RecipientBusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: NC STATE UNIVERSITY COLLEGE OF TEXTILES

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: TO PROVIDE FOR STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS, FUND RESEARCH AND PROFESSORSHIPS AND ASSIST WITH CAPITAL PURCHASES

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION DETERMINES THE AMOUNT OF THE GRANT TO THE COLLEGE BASED ON THE FAIR MARKET VALUE OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS AND MONITORS THE DISBURSEMENT OF THE GRANT THROUGH MONTHLY REPORTS RECEIVED FROM THE COLLEGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE J, PART II - COMPENSATION FROM RELATED ORGANIZATIONS
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD MEMBERS THAT ARE COMPENSATED RECEIVE COMPENSATION FROM NC STATE UNIVERSITY, A 170(C)(1) ORGANIZATION RELATED TO THE NORTH CAROLINA TEXTILE FOUNDATION, INC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BYLAWS WERE AMENDED AS OF OCTOBER 2022 AS FOLLOWS: ARTICLE II SECTION 2: THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS, HEREINAFTER REFERRED TO AS THE BOARD, SHALL BE COMPRISED OF NOT LESS THAN THIRTEEN (13) AND NOT MORE THAN TWENTY-ONE (21) VOTING MEMBERS CONSISTING OF ELECTED DIRECTORS AND EX-OFFICIO DIRECTORS AS FOLLOWS: ... ARTICLE II SECTION 3: EACH ELECTED DIRECTOR, IN CONSULTATION WITH THE MEMBERSHIP & EDUCATION COMMITTEE IN THE FINAL YEAR OF EACH FOUR (4) YEAR TERM, SHALL HAVE THE FOLLOWING OPTIONS FOR MANAGING THEIR TWELVE (12) YEARS OF SERVICE: 1. SERVE THREE (3) FOUR (4) YEAR TERMS CONSECUTIVELY OVER TWELVE (12) YEARS... 2. SERVE TWO (2) FOUR (4) YEAR TERMS CONSECUTIVELY OVER EIGHT (8) YEARS AND COMPLETE THE FINAL ONE (1) FOUR (4) YEAR TERM AT A LATER DATE, TO BE DETERMINED BY THE ELECTED DIRECTOR AND THE M & E COMMITTEE... 3. SERVE ONE (1) FOUR (4) YEAR TERM AND COMPLETE THE FINAL TWO (2) FOUR (4) YEAR TERMS AT A LATER DATE, TO BE DETERMINED BY THE ELECTED DIRECTOR AND THE M & E COMMITTEE...

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE BOARD MEMBERS TO REVIEW AND APPROVE PRIOR TO THE FILING DEADLINE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: BOARD MEMBERS ARE REQUIRED TO REVIEW AND SIGN THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AT EACH BOARD MEETING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR AND OTHER EMPLOYEES ARE PAID BY A RELATED ORGANIZATION (COLLEGE OF TEXTILES, NC STATE UNIVERSITY). THE COLLEGE DETERMINES THE COMPENSATION OF THE EMPLOYEES BASED ON STATE PAY GRADES AND BUDGETARY CONSIDERATIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC ONLINE OR UPON WRITTEN REQUEST.
CHANGE IN VALUE OF SPLIT INTEREST AGREEMENTS -35,029.
THE PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM PRIOR YEAR.
